pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:0.5: 67. The training rule on covered heads
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people with covered heads. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.3.1: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.5: the upper robe also covers the head is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.6: One should not give a teaching to anyone with a covered head who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.7: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone with a covered head who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.13: if he teaches the person after getting them to uncover their head;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.16: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk67:1.17: The seventh training rule is finished.
